    About Me

    Hi! I‚Äôm Golam Azom, a computational chemist passionate about using molecular simulations and machine learning to understand and engineer complex systems at the atomic scale.

    I‚Äôm currently a Ph.D. candidate in Chemistry at Louisiana State University under the guidance of Prof. Revati Kumar and a Computational Chemistry Materials Science (CCMS) Intern at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory under the mentorship of Dr. Tuan Anh Pham.

    My work bridges classical and ab initio molecular dynamics simulation, enhanced sampling, and machine learning to understand phenomena at solid‚Äìliquid interfaces, for application in water purification, separations, catalysis, and energy storage.
